results.title: Stagestruck 2
results.creator_credit: Bob Harvey, TLC Films and Spellcaster Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 separate episodes, this is the second of a series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production and in particular, amateur theatre. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered in this volume include: Pantomimes; School plays; Makeup techniques; Costume selection; Actors workshop and improvisation; Set design preparation for first rehearsal; Lighting; Prop designing, construction and tracking; Stage manager’s hints and tips for keeping the production on track. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed throughout the program.

results.title: Spotlights: George Miller
results.brief_description: An Australian filmmaker and former physician. He is best known for his Mad Max franchise, whose second instalment, Mad Max 2 (1981), and fourth, Fury Road (2015), have been hailed as among the greatest action films of all time.

constellations_primary.name: George Miller
constellations_primary.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.description: An Australian filmmaker and former physician, George Miller is best known for his Mad Max franchise, whose second instalment, Mad Max 2 (1981), and fourth, Fury Road (2015), have been hailed as among the greatest action films of all time. George discusses storytelling and how it helps us make our way through the world.
description_for_label: An Australian filmmaker and former physician, George Miller is best known for his Mad Max franchise, whose second instalment, Mad Max 2 (1981), and fourth, Fury Road (2015), have been hailed as among the greatest action films of all time. George discusses storytelling and how it helps us make our way through the world.

results.title: Stagestruck 1
results.creator_credit: Bob Harvey, TLC Films and Spellcaster Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 separate episodes, this is the first of a comprehensive and informative series of three videos on everything you would like to know about theatre production, and in particular, amateur theatre. Amateur dramatics attracts people of all ages, from different backgrounds and for various personal reasons and this series, through the help of professional actors, directors, designers and stage managers, provides expert help and guidance to newcomers and even old-hands. Presented by Christina Barryk, aspects covered include: Set design, planning, painting, construction and set change; Makeup techniques for character roles; Stage manager’s role; Drama director and Actors’ workshop; Props and costumes; Sound equipment; Artistic director’s role; Lighting; Touring companies. Also includes personal anecdotes interspersed throughout the program.

results.title: Stages
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Stages salutes Canada’s performing artists, the singers, dancers and actors, some already famous and others struggling to make a name for themselves. In a film featuring a small group of them, they communicate through the medium of their craft the significance of being Canadian entertainers. Excerpts from such shows as Billy Bishop Goes to War, Margie Gillis’s one-woman show and Clemence Desrochers’s bitingly witty monologues highlight the vitality and multicultural flavour of the country’s performing arts. (Award: Salerno.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Spotlights: Rachel Perkins
results.brief_description: An Australian film and television director, producer, and screenwriter. She is known for her films Radiance (1998), One Night the Moon (2001), Bran Nue Dae (2009) and Jasper Jones (2017). Rachel discusses the merits of film and television from an Indigenous perspective, particularly in relation to audience.

constellations_primary.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_primary.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.description: Rachel Perkins is an Australian film and TV director, producer and screenwriter. She’s known for her films Radiance (1998), One Night the Moon (2001), Bran Nue Dae (2009) and Jasper Jones (2017), and is co-director of landmark TV series First Australians. Rachel discusses the merits of film and TV from an Indigenous perspective, particularly in relation to the audience.
description_for_label: Rachel Perkins is an Australian film and TV director, producer and screenwriter. She’s known for her films Radiance (1998), One Night the Moon (2001), Bran Nue Dae (2009) and Jasper Jones (2017), and is co-director of landmark TV series First Australians. Rachel discusses the merits of film and TV from an Indigenous perspective, particularly in relation to the audience.

results.title: Stage Fright
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock and Warner Brothers First National Productions
results.brief_description: Drama student Eve Gill (Jane Wyman) envisions the acting challenge of a lifetime in the desperate predicament of boyfriend Jonathan Cooper (Richard Todd) who is framed for murder by the flamboyant stage star Charlotte Inwood (Marlene Dietrich). To prove Jonathan’s innocence, the naive Eve impersonates a maid and works for Charlotte but discovers that where murder is involved, life does not follow a script. Representing the glamour and bitchiness of the theatre, movie legend Marlene Dietrich makes the vain, manipulative Charlotte one of her most colourful characterisations and her rendition of Cole Porter’s “The Laziest gal in town” is both sexy and provocative. Co-starring Michael Wilding, Richard Todd, Alistair Sim, Sybil Thorndike, Joyce Grenfell and Kay Walsh. Based on a novel by Selwyn Jepson.
